body.name: Wave Rowing Machine with 16" HD Touchscreen & Speakers - Foldable | Live Home Workouts, Subscription Required
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 26 mins
features: HIGH-ENERGY & LOW IMPACT: Engage more than 86% of major muscle groups in high-energy, low-impact workouts in under 20 minutes. The Hydrow Wave Rowing Machine is a full-body workout machine that uses our patented electromagnetic drag technology that makes every workout on this indoor rower feel like you are rowing on the water.

IMMERSIVE WORKOUTS: The Hydrow Wave rowing machine features a 16" HD touchscreen display and front-facing speakers that instantly takes you to Scandianvian fjords, the wilds of Alaska, and beyond. Your membership unlocks access to over 4,000 live and on-demand workouts with world-class Athletes, around the globe.

MEMBERSHIP BENEFITS: Your $44/ month membership gives you full access to the entire Hydrow library for full-body workouts on your Hydrow Wave at-home rower and the Hydrow app. From rowing to strength training, mobility, yoga, pilates, and circuit-training. With unlimited profiles, saving individual access to stats and progress is easy.

EASILY STORED: This foldable rowing machine can be stored upright using our Vertical Anchor (sold separately) and is the perfect at home workout equpiment. Dimensions: 80"L x 19"W x 43"H; Weight: 102lbs; Weight Limit; up to 375 pounds.

EASY ASSEMBLY: This foldable rowing machine is easy to assemble, although expert in-home assembly is also available for purchase (for an additional charge). Please note that this rower is heavy, and should be lifted or carried by more than one person.
COMPATIBILITY: The Hydrow Wave Rowing Machine is 5.0 Bluetooth-enabled, and is compatible with most Bluetooth headphones, hearing aids, speakers, and many ANT+ and Bluetooth heart rate monitors.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Is a subscription required to use the Hydrow? A subscription is not required, however, having a subscription is an integral part of the Hydrow experience. Without a subscription the rower will operate in Just Row mode and have limited functionality. What is included in a Hydrow membership? Membership enables access to the majority of Hydrow’s functions including: multiple user profiles, daily live workouts, on-demand rowing workouts, On The Mat fitness content, a community of fellow rowers, and much more. How many people can use one Hydrow? Each machine can have as many profiles as you would like. Only one paid membership per Hydrow is required. Stats and progress for each profile are saved independently. What devices are compatible with the Hydrow? Hydrow is 5.0 Bluetooth-enabled and is compatible with most Bluetooth headphones, hearing-aids, and speakers. Can I assemble the Hydrow myself? Yes. In-home assembly is also available for purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love my Hydrow Wave. I’ve never enjoyed exercise equipment so much, Be sure to get good form (I like Dark Horse Rowing on YouTube).The videos give the feeling of being in the water. It’s a great form of exercise that even a 95 year old can do. (I’m not 95)Worth the money. Don’t go cheap.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product! Great Workout!
reviews.reviewText: I've been debating buying a rower for a long time and finally pulled the trigger on the Hydrow Wave after looking at many alternatives. My home gym is pretty full already, so I chose the Wave over the Hydrow to save space. It came really well packaged, with simple to follow instructions (both video and a paper guide). Took me about 20 min to assemble then another 5 or 10 to get my profile set up, etc. The outdoor rowing content is great - I've never been on the water so it's all pretty novel. The seat and pulleys are quiet and smooth. It's so much quieter and smoother than the Concept2 rowers I've tried at CrossFit gyms. Highly recommend - a really sturdy, quality piece of equipment with great content.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My wife and I love it!
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this a little over a month ago, and my wife and I love it! We've both been looking for a guided workout routine that would keep us motivated to stick with it. This has done the trick for us, because we're both a month in and actively look for reasons to do it.I have desk job where I'm on the computer all day doing IT support, and the stress and posture aggravate my lower back and cause my shoulders to tense up. This has helped alleviate that tension and pain. I'm starting to notice my gut getting a little more tone as well which is a plus.For the Mrs, she's looking to tone her stomach as well, but she's also looking to stay heart healthy, and so far it is helping.Although we could use this strictly as a rower, we find the subscription too be worth it since it's cheaper and more convenient than both of us going to a gym, and more effective than self guiding through a workout simply listening to music. One subscription works for both of us, so that's a plus. I particularly Nick and Aquil as instructors. They make the workouts fun.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Perfect Rower for Small Spaces
reviews.reviewText: I never thought I could fit a high quality rowing machine in my apartment, but the Hydrow Wave is my answer! It has a sleek compact design plus a large screen for guided workouts with absolutely gorgeous scenery. It was delivered right to my door and was super easy to assemble. Rowing on the Wave is top notch with a quiet, smooth pull and comfortable grip. Plus, I can store it upright whenever I’m not using it. Although you can use the machine without it, the subscription opens up so many workout possibilities, from rowing in beautiful destinations around the world to finding your yoga flow. This is the perfect at-home alternative to a gym membership and much more convenient!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Quality but pricey machine, lousy software and subscription service
reviews.reviewText: To be fair, I will start here - the machine itself is a quality rowing machine, for sure. Quality craftsmanship, well engineered, very quiet and smooth. That being said, it is overpriced - I would value the machine at $1K - $1200 or so. It is somewhat manageable when it comes to storage as standing it upright makes it fairly feasible to place in a corner of a room… but it still has a footprint, this isn't going to fold up neatly under your bed or be completely unnoticeable to company in the living room, mind you. I was not impressed with their stow away kit and returned it, it actually felt like the machine was taking up more space than without it.Where this product really falls flat though is with the tech and the subscription service.The tech aspect… the screen is ok, it doesn't knock my socks off, the resolution for this day and age is ok but rather underwhelming. The speakers in the unit are less than impressive, they sound very tinny and lack depth. Connectivity with Apple Watch and workout tracking also sucks hard. I sometimes struggle to make a connection with the watch for BPM tracking, and it sometimes drops out during a workout. It creates Apple Fitness workouts for you, but it is a mystery when it will decide to sync the workout with Apple and sometimes takes a while for it to appear in your Fitness app.They don't make it easy to make adjustments on the fly while working out. One of the key adjustments I often make is lowering or raising the volume. You have to use a button on the side of the screen that is waaaay out in front of you during the workout, and it opens a modal window while you are raising the volume with the physical buttons which blocks the ongoing workout video and only goes away if you tap outside of it on the screen. SOOOO ANNOYING!They promote the subscription service heavily, and even try to warn you away from purchasing the machine if you are not interested in subscribing as they claim the experience is not complete without it. Let me tell you, this is a wildly overpriced and overhyped service.They claim to have a huge library of "workouts", but they aren't all rowing workouts… sorry, I don't need a menagerie of octogenarian workouts doing elementary things with 15lb weights. It's trying to be a complete fitness solution, but I don't need that and don't want that - I just want to focus on the rowing, because… I bought a freaking rowing machine.The instructors themselves are just so so. They often lack focus on the actual rowing during the workout… why am I listening to this guy go on about the challenges of parenthood? JUST SHUT UP AND ROW, MAN! I find myself now these days muting the instructors and setting my own pace, they are just there as (expensive) wallpaper while I do my workout now.Not only is the library and the instructors disappointing, but the whole concept of being able to compete and track your performance relative to others is a demoralizing sham. In each rowing workout there is an average of maybe 4K users listed who rowed previously, and you can see where you fall in the pecking order of relative performance while you row. Problem is - I row hard and fast at a sustained pitch like 39 s/m with elevated drag and I can never seem to crack the ~50% mark. I'm a pretty fit dude, and I'm rowing faster than I can imagine is physically possible while still doing legit rowing correctly, and I can never do better than average after weeks of doing this nearly every day! It's amazing I haven't quit yet.The subscription service is probably worth about half of the asking price. It is the same price as the Peloton service, which is higher quality and can be used across multiple fitness machines/devices, whereas with Hydrow it's the one machine and that's it, unless you are a rowing freak and have multiple Hydrow rowing machines.To cap it all off, I worked hard to reach my 100K meter achievement milestone for the free water bottle, but find I have to pay $12 for shipping via USPS' cheapest and slowest shipping service… geez, if I want a water bottle I guess I'll just go to the store and buy one of my choice to pat myself on the back then. Thanks for nothing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Favorite Rowing Machine
reviews.reviewText: I was on the rowing team in college and have lots of experience on the water and on various rowing machines. The Hydrow is now my favorite rowing machine I’ve used. The monthly membership opens a variety of workout possibilities on and off the rower, but it serves as a high quality rower even without it. The pull is so smooth and it really is the closest machine to feel similar to being out on the water. It is such a convenient piece of equipment to have at home, I’ve used it almost every day since it arrived. It’s fits nicely in the space I have and is not too overwhelming for a one bedroom apartment. The set up video made the assembly a breeze. I’m looking forward to all my future workouts with my Hydrow!
